fields.description:
I tried using one of the default stack templates to create a stack.  Upon doing so, I received the following error:
{code}
2015-06-05 14:16:47 ERROR eucalyptus/admin@10.5.1.30 [TOVVLEo3mrjKLHGP]: Invalid S3 url https://localhost:8773/services/objectstorage/cf-template-000078933246-euca/EucaConsole%20Deploy.json?Signature=CpWAI3H10%2BCePCp%2FB0crDFFgctc%3D&Expires=1433539307&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAAWHU5XQYSJUQKNSL&x-amz-security-token=ZXVjYQAB3%2BTUQF%2BuxxwIhnDQx2mi49O03iHcR5D8i0Nc/xf8tPonZb0X1WpONmzxaPxQd1mTsDQgGuYOg9gsZggYkvQ9BmkfX%2BU3Ny9IhPCOOmsXARo7qimVftREO4J2p7VCKNMUB9VLcGqUolG3J8L88I1zZ9hH6ZOgt5MbdT0M3MaVb0tC8JwY%2B%2BTsyE/1NsNNrFzRkVOkF/UXB8TpJPE%2Bo3vHjbM08Ko/vZiL%2BLCEc7JjbX8oFc%2BIxJCBPw%3D%3D, does not match any known S3 domains
{code}
I tried both templates ('EucaConsole Deploy' and 'LAMP Stack') and received the same error from both.

To reproduce:
1. Navigate to Stacks landing page
2. Create a stack
3. Choose one of the items from the 'Use a sample template' drop-down list and click 'Next'.
4. Enter all the information
5. Click 'Create Stack'

Expected result: A stack should be created
What actually happens: The above error occurs and the stack does not get created.
fields.summary: Error creating stack when using template

comments.body: [~dkavanagh], can you take a look at this one and if needed, confirm and assign to yourself please? Thanks!

[~ccassler], much of the code related to this has been changed in the GUI-1637 branch. Would you mind testing there to see if this is still a problem? If you'd rather wait for packages, we can try after it's merged.

[~dkavanagh]: I've been having issues getting the source code to work in my environment.  I'll see if I can get some help with this.  Also, I'm going to increase this to Blocker because the problem has actually gotten worse.  I can't create a stack at all now with the latest version.  I'm currently using this version:
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.1                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.6468.418.20150609git1fc4352.el6   Build Date: Tue 09 Jun 2015 09:43:39 AM PDT
Install Date: Tue 09 Jun 2015 12:05:47 PM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-88
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.1-0.0.6468.418.20150609git1fc4352.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 14382203                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
{code}

[~dkavanagh]:
I was able to get an rpm build from the branch mentioned above.  The rpm installed, however, when I try to run it, I get the following error:
{code}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/eucaconsole", line 114, in <module>
    start_console()
  File "/usr/bin/eucaconsole", line 79, in start_console
    load_entry_point('pyramid==1.4', 'console_scripts', 'pserve')(args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/scripts/pserve.py", line 50, in main
    return command.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/scripts/pserve.py", line 304, in run
    global_conf=vars)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/scripts/pserve.py", line 328, in loadapp
    return loadapp(app_spec, name=name, relative_to=relative_to, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 247, in loadapp
    return loadobj(APP, uri, name=name, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 272, in loadobj
    return context.create()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 710, in create
    return self.object_type.invoke(self)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 146, in invoke
    return fix_call(context.object, context.global_conf, **context.local_conf)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/util.py", line 56, in fix_call
    val = callable(*args, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/config.py", line 194, in main
    app_config = get_configurator(settings)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/config.py", line 120, in get_configurator
    config.scan()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/__init__.py", line 947, in scan
    ignore=ignore)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/venusian/__init__.py", line 191, in scan
    __import__(modname)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/views/stacks.py", line 32, in <module>
    from simplejson import JSONDecodeError
ImportError: cannot import name JSONDecodeError
{code}

RPM Version:
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.1                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.6493.21.20150610git3e87879.el6   Build Date: Wed 10 Jun 2015 02:49:36 PM PDT
Install Date: Wed 10 Jun 2015 02:59:33 PM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-154
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.1-0.0.6493.21.20150610git3e87879.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 14468683                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
{code}
I have a fix for that. The error class isn't available in python 2.6, so we need to use a different one.

[~dkavanagh]: This issue appears to be fixed in this build.  I wasn't able to reproduce it.  Did you want to change this bug to fixed?
{code}
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.1                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.6555.428.20150618git2fb782d.el6   Build Date: Thu 18 Jun 2015 12:00:16 PM PDT
Install Date: Thu 18 Jun 2015 12:37:11 PM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-181
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.1-0.0.6555.428.20150618git2fb782d.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 14392999                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
{code}
[~dkavanagh]: I take this back.  I'm still having this issue but it's happening with other templates.  I will attach the templates to this bug.
[~ccassler], did the console.ini contain "localhost" for the ufshost? That would be a problem for this as well as s3 object downloads.

I notice that when accessing that template via buckets pages, I can download it that way. This error seems to be specific to the stack code. Investigating.
Pasting the URL in the error message into the browser lets me download the file also.
Tested the code in stacks.py which reads this using urllib2 and that works. This error must be from the back end which can't resolve this. [~ethomas], what do you make of this?

Here's the URL in question: https://g-19-11.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/objectstorage/cf-template-000216319833-euca/Basic%20Instance.json?Signature=wqTjfWmCNi49ktbj0eYwquQd6eQ%3D&Expires=1436358655&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAAO6Q6WZ5ICODF7QB&x-amz-security-token=ZXVjYQABmr%2BQlJvEK4HSTTDW5GaEGjMN4hqQgb41uXz%2BK/d17ysE/I0%2BMxFUdBUwhRNu%2BRHksGex6dBl2wy757x9KWIpk7ld0LwBEt1p4av1wowVeZzijR1p7p/mtYye3hDHRIP5VJT/pV44ElVBKltguWEiRAY%2BNRmh4lFRVG%2BOSUjbStfG2z0ec4RiAFT3l5xF8NBkHWnb8xkF29zfMHD2a6sLpIJYAhb4NaFEvCcwGm3IIt0IDVTAkZ4dXQ%3D%3D 

I know this host is using SSL with a self-signed cert.

[~dkavanagh]  A couple of thoughts on this.  First "localhost:8773" is not something CF expects as an S3 URL.  It either expects a URL with "walrus" or "objectstorage" in the URL, or an IP address and port.  Second, as to your issue with the self signed certificate, java is picky about SSL connections at times.  Does the SSL cert host name match the URL?  We could try isolating it to SSL connections.

[~ethomas], yes, I agree about localhost and in the console configuration docs, we recommend against using localhost.
The issue is likely about SSL. I had to confirm a security exception in the browser to download the file because it's a self-signed cert. I suspect we'll need to handle this case in general. What can be done on the back end? Python seems more forgiving, but from a security standpoint, how forgiving should we be when a valid CA is not in the cert chain?

[~dkavanagh], FWIW, the certificate in question here has an invalid Canonical Name (as [~ethomas] mentioned may be the case).

This one is invalid (at depth=0);
{code}
# openssl s_client -host localhost -port 8773
CONNECTED(00000003)
depth=0 C = US, O = Cloud, OU = Eucalyptus, CN = eucalyptus
verify error:num=18:self signed certificate
verify return:1
depth=0 C = US, O = Cloud, OU = Eucalyptus, CN = eucalyptus
verify return:1
---
Certificate chain
 0 s:/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=eucalyptus
   i:/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=eucalyptus
---
{code}
This one is valid (at depth=0):
{code}
# openssl s_client -host hp.com -port 443
CONNECTED(00000003)
depth=3 C = US, O = "VeriSign, Inc.", OU = Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority
verify return:1
depth=2 C = US, O = "VeriSign, Inc.", OU = VeriSign Trust Network, OU = "(c) 2006 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", CN = VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G5
verify return:1
depth=1 C = US, O = Symantec Corporation, OU = Symantec Trust Network, CN = Symantec Class 3 Secure Server CA - G4
verify return:1
depth=0 C = US, ST = California, L = Palo Alto, O = Hewlett-Packard, OU = Operations, *CN = www.hp.com*
verify return:1
---
Certificate chain
 0 s:/C=US/ST=California/L=Palo Alto/O=Hewlett-Packard/OU=Operations/CN=www.hp.com
   i:/C=US/O=Symantec Corporation/OU=Symantec Trust Network/CN=Symantec Class 3 Secure Server CA - G4
 1 s:/C=US/O=Symantec Corporation/OU=Symantec Trust Network/CN=Symantec Class 3 Secure Server CA - G4
   i:/C=US/O=VeriSign, Inc./OU=VeriSign Trust Network/OU=(c) 2006 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only/CN=VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G5
 2 s:/C=US/O=VeriSign, Inc./OU=VeriSign Trust Network/OU=(c) 2006 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only/CN=VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G5
   i:/C=US/O=VeriSign, Inc./OU=Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority
---
{code}
euca-modify-property -pbootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_enable_hostname_verification=false

[~rusvika], [~ethomas], [~decker],
The above property setting seems to fix the problem (did for me, and I've asked Casey to verify). Would adding this to the documentation where we talk about people setting up ssl certs help? Are we generating a default cert on install, or first run? If that's the case, can we default this to "false"? I would assume that's less secure and therefore probably a no-go. I want to be sure we work "out of the box" if possible and/or document this properly.
[~dkavanagh]: I am now able to create stacks on 10.111.1.135 where the eucalyptus property 'bootstrap.webservices.ssl.user_ssl_enable_hostname_verification'  was changed to false.

[~rusvika], I would like to know your thoughts on this. If the UFS defaults to using a self-signed certificate, we should also set this property to false, but I imagine there are security implications. At the very least, I want this documented, but we should make the system as a whole work in this regard "out of the box".

from call w/ [~rusvika] and [~ethomas]:
This property could be set to false by default under the following conditions:
   - it only affects stack code (which seems to be the case)
   - it only affects checking of our internal urls, not AWS-S3 or whitelisted external domains

[~ethomas] to check w/ Steve about options for verifying only in certain situations
[~dkavanagh] to test non-signed url, whether or not it helps in this case, it's simpler.

[~dkavanagh], please try adjusting the "cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist" property, it is incorrectly whitelisting the clouds own S3 service, which means the template retrieval will fail rather than using the internal retrieval mechanism.	E.g. remove "*qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com" from the whitelist.

[~ethomas], boto is generating the URL. In the case of the unsigned url, I simply removed the query params that comprise the signing values.
I could generate the URL myself w/o signing and make it look the way you say with objectstorage.<dnsname> in the URL

I have verified that adding "git." into the whitelist causes the URL to go into the S3 parsing code.
cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist: '*s3.amazonaws.com,*git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com'

[~ethomas], I tested w/ a setup I built from nightlies this morning.
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/783/
I tried creating a stack and got this still.
 Invalid S3 url https://e-39.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/objectstorage/cf-template-000937242181-euca/Basic%20Instance.json, does not match any known S3 domains

In QA there doesn't seem to be a reason to guess service endpoints since we already know what they are. My impression was that we would allow a domain to be configured for the console and derive hostnames for the services from that ( GUI-1722 )

I'd like point out some scenarios that we hope would work and customers may depend on:
 - console on same host as UFS and while it may use localhost(or 127.0.0.1), it should not, rather use a dns name for the UFS (so that S3 object links we give our users will resolve).
 - console on a standalone host, we would expect the UFS host ip or dns name would be used here
 - console on an instance (standalone?). same expectations as any standalone host
 - console behind an ELB. this should make no difference and be like the above 2 scenarios
 - UFS host(s) behind an ELB. In this case, the console would want to use the "public" UFS endpoint, being the ELB external address(name). We would provide this to access S3 objects and we would also be using this to feed into a CreateStack call since that's the only way we know to access the objectstorage UFS endpoint.

That last scenario makes me thing doing anything with the host in the URL is pointless. As I mentioned to Evan in Lync earlier, pulling the bucket/key out of the URL and using that for an authenticated GET as the current user would pass if things are correct, or fail if those things don't exist. Either way, it's all good. Console would work, if user tries to pull a fast one and specify a bucket/key on another cloud, it will fail appropriately.
Sounds like y'all might resolve this faster if you get together for a short lync meeting. Seems to have many moving parts.
Once I fixed the auth and dns.endpoint stuff, I was able to create a stack! yee haw!

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1505

Need to use ufshost in QA clouds like:

e-39.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

Notice "autoqa"
would love to see this merged sooner than any other... helps when testing stack wizard to be able to create stacks!
PR 1505 merged
[~ccassler], as noted in a comment above, you'll need to set ufshost = g-19-11.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

[~dkavanagh]
OK, so it turns out my whitelist euca property was incorrect.  I updated it and now stack creation is working.
{code}
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-describe-properties | grep whitelist
PROPERTY        cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist     *s3.amazonaws.com,*qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-modify-property -p cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist='*s3.amazonaws.com, git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com'
PROPERTY        cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist     *s3.amazonaws.com, git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com was *s3.amazonaws.com,*qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-describe-properties | grep whitelist
PROPERTY        cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist     *s3.amazonaws.com, git.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
{code}

Validated.  After changing the ufshost to 'g-19-11.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com', I am now able to create stacks.
{code}
[root@euca-10-111-75-201 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.2.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.7043.493.20150805git92d70ca.el6   Build Date: Wed 05 Aug 2015 09:01:31 PM UTC
Install Date: Wed 05 Aug 2015 03:17:58 PM UTC      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-154
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.2.0-0.0.7043.493.20150805git92d70ca.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 18734534                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
{code}
